title: The only World Series preview you need: Odds, likely MVPs and how many games Dodgers-Blue Jays will go
content: Does L.A. or Toronto have the edge? How do you pitch Ohtani and Vlad Jr.? What will decide the Fall Classic? We've got it all covered.

title: eBay gloves, cursing pitchers and unhittable splits: The magic chemistry of the Blue Jays
content: The Toronto roster is full of personality and talent. Here are some of the best stories from the clubhouse.

title: Sources: Storm to hire Liberty's Raman as coach
content: Liberty assistant Sonia Raman has agreed to a multiyear deal to become the new head coach of the Seattle Storm, sources told ESPN on Friday.

title: Eagles without WR Brown (hamstring) vs. Giants
content: Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown will not play against the Giants after being sidelined all week with a hamstring injury.

title: Giants, Daboll, Skattebo all fined over Dart exam
content: The Giants were assessed a $200,000 fine for violating the concussion protocol around an exam of quarterback Jaxon Dart, while coach Brian Daboll was fined $100,000 and RB Cam Skattebo $15,000 for conduct detrimental to the league.

title: C's Brown: NBA not shielding players over betting
content: Celtics forward and NBPA vice president Jaylen Brown said the NBA isn't doing enough to help players around sports betting issues in the sport.

title: Jays' Bichette to start at 2B, bat cleanup in G1
content: Bo Bichette, who has not played since early September due to a knee injury, will start at second base and bat cleanup for the Blue Jays in Game 1 of the World Series against the Dodgers on Friday night in Toronto.

title: Ex-EMU players refused to aid betting probe
content: Three former men's basketball players at Eastern Michigan refused to participate in an investigation into potential sports betting infractions involving multiple Eagles games from the 2024-25 season, the NCAA announced Friday.

title: Adebayo: Heat offering 'full support' to Rozier
content: The reality began setting in for the Heat when they gathered for a morning shootaround practice and Terry Rozier wasn't with the team.

title: Vitello: 'Selfish' but 'right' call to manage Giants
content: Tony Vitello told reporters he leaned on "anyone and everyone" before making the decision to leave the Tennessee baseball program and manage the Giants.

title: 12 more NFL Week 8 games: We have predictions, picks and wild stats
content: Aaron Rodgers vs. Green Bay? Can Bills and Ravens get back on track? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 8 game.

title: Aaron Rodgers at home with Steelers, at peace with Packers
content: There's a fire still burning inside the QB who's happy in Pittsburgh but respectful of his time in Green Bay.

title: NBA gambling investigation live updates: Latest arrests, statements, more
content: Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups, Heat guard Terry Rozier and former Cavs player Damon Jones have been arrested in connection with the probes.

title: UFC 321: Inside Tom Aspinall's unique heavyweight strategy
content: Tom Aspinall and his father and coach, Andy, have developed a strategy that has yet to be truly tested.

title: Mbappé vs. Yamal is the new Ronaldo vs. Messi -- so which Clasico star is better?
content: Not since Messi vs. Ronaldo has the Barcelona-Real Madrid rivalry given us a matchup like Yamal vs. Mbappe. So, which superstar would you rather have?

title: Madrid vs. Barça head-to-head, form, key clashes, predictions, odds
content: When Real Madrid and Barcelona face off, there's nothing bigger happening anywhere in the soccer world.

title: NFC East roundtable: Can the defending champs take the division crown again?
content: So far, every team in the NFC East except the Eagles has played three division games. Here's how they stack up.

title: Giants-Eagles rivalry and the punt that lives in NFL infamy
content: DeSean Jackson and Matt Dodge relive a 15-year-old shank and a walk-off return that fans will never forget.

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: Amorim's record has a missing middle: Can Man United solve the riddle of midtable sides?
content: Ruben Amorim and Manchester United are flying high after beating Liverpool, but it's not the Big Six they should be most worried about.

title: Soccer's longest away trips: Journeys that clock up thousands of miles, cross continents
content: Truro is preparing to make the longest round trip for a professional league match in English soccer history.

title: USWNT's shock loss to Portugal shows lack of problem-solving, but no cause for alarm (yet)
content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

title: Piastri: Norris & I have 'clean slate' in Mexico
content: Oscar Piastri has confirmed that he and McLaren teammate Lando Norris are starting from a "clean slate" at the Mexican Grand Prix after the Australian took responsibility for their collision at the U.S. Grand Prix.

title: Norris laughs off Red Bull sticky tape 'side quests'
content: Lando Norris has laughed off Red Bull's attempts to remove tape from the pit wall that he was using as a visual aid to ensure his car was not too far forward in its grid slot.

title: Round 1 preview, predictions: Can anyone stop Philly?
content: Now that the Wild Card games are over with, the MLS postseason moves into the best-of-three Round 1. Who will move on? ESPN makes its predictions.

title: NBA intel: Wemby's new game plan, and early concerns for Lakers and Rockets
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst take the pulse of the league after a thrilling first few nights of 2025-26.

title: Amir Abdur-Rahim's legacy lives on 1 year after his sudden passing
content: Those closest to the late South Florida coach remember him one year after his death shocked college basketball.

title: Top 100 men's NCAA basketball players going into 2025-26
content: From seniors who have taken the national stage before to freshmen entering the spotlight, here is our 1-100.

title: Bilas' 2025 preseason All-America teams
content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: Grateful Ducks: Oregon's Grateful Dead uniforms top best Week 9 threads in college football
content: The crowd theme for Oregon's game against Wisconsin this week is tie-dye, and the Ducks are incorporating a number of Grateful Dead motifs into their uniforms.

title: Last-minute pickups: Bucs duo of Tez Johnson, Cade Otton among top Week 8 options
content: If this heavy bye week or injuries have you seeking lineup help, we have available options to consider.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Colts, Patriots among top options in Week 8
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 8, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Andhra bus fire: Phones, elbows, laptops were tools of survival; narrow escape for many
content: A festive weekend trip turned terrifying for Hyderabad-Bengaluru bus passengers as flames engulfed their vehicle. Survivors recounted harrowing escapes, using fists and laptops to break windows and flee the inferno. Amidst panic, acts of courage and desperation unfolded as individuals fought for survival, leaving lasting impressions of the near-fatal ordeal.

title: Durgapur gang rape: Survivor identifies 5 accused; lawyer hails 'satisfactory results'
content: Durgapur gang rape survivor identified five accused during a Test Identification parade at the correctional home. The sixth accused, known to the survivor, was not part of the parade. The investigation is progressing well, with police focusing on the roles of those involved in the rape and subsequent extortion.

title: Andhra, Rajasthan bus fires: 2 incidents in a month spark concerns; focus back on strict safety norms
content: The tragic bus fires in Andhra and Rajasthan, which have taken the lives of more than 40 individuals, have sparked urgent discussions around passenger safety. As authorities roll out stricter bus body regulations, including the incorporation of fire alarms and emergency exits, significant challenges remain due to outdated vehicles and insufficient local enforcement.

title: 'Might impede probe': Court denies bail to influencer Jyoti Malhotra; accused of 'spying'
content: A Hisar court has struck down the bail plea of social media influencer Jyoti Malhotra over espionage accusations, underlining the delicate nature of national security. Concerns were raised that allowing her release might compromise the integrity of the ongoing investigation.

title: US techies in Silicon Valley falling into Cold War-era 'Chinese trap': Report
content: Female spies have a long history, with recent reports alleging China and Russia are employing "sex warfare" to steal Silicon Valley secrets. Attractive operatives are reportedly seducing tech workers, even marrying them, to infiltrate the industry and acquire trade secrets. This tactic, alongside other methods like startup competitions and venture capital investments, highlights a growing espionage threat to American innovation.

title: Summit to sanctions: Trump's oil shock - will Putin end Ukraine war?
content: In a significant shift, the US has imposed stringent sanctions on Russia's top oil firms, Rosneft and Lukoil, targeting the financial backbone of its war in Ukraine. This move, aimed at crippling Moscow's revenue streams, has already impacted global oil markets and prompted major buyers like China and India to reassess their purchases.

title: 1 doctor for 1,000 people: WHO 'standard' that never was
content: The widely cited 1 doctor per 1,000 population ratio is a myth, the WHO has clarified. This figure, often used by governments to justify expanding medical colleges, lacks WHO backing. Experts emphasize that health workforce planning must consider unique national needs, not a universal benchmark. The actual WHO threshold for essential health services is higher and more nuanced.

title: Musk’s $1 trillion pay: Tesla CEO slams advisory firms; calls their past advice destructive
content: Elon Musk unleashed a scathing attack on proxy advisory firms ISS and Glass Lewis, labeling them 'corporate terrorists' for recommending shareholders reject his massive pay package.  Musk accused the influential firms of making 'extremely destructive' and 'terrible recommendations' in the past, claiming they vote along political lines and lack genuine understanding of companies like Tesla.

title: Will Bihar say 'Tejashwi Bhava'? Mahagathbandhan's latest election gamble explained
content: The Mahagathbandhan has named 36-year-old Tejashwi Yadav as its chief ministerial face for the Bihar elections, aiming to consolidate its M-Y base and present a youth-driven alternative. This move contrasts with the NDA's aging leadership and indecision, but risks alienating other OBC groups and faces the 'Jungle Raj' narrative.

title: 'Bike came under bus, dragged by it': How Andhra fire mishap unfolded; 20 dead
content: A tragic bus fire in Andhra Pradesh, claiming 20 lives, was ignited when a motorcycle was dragged beneath the vehicle. Sparks from the collision, combined with flammable bus materials and a cargo of cell phones, rapidly intensified the blaze. Authorities have established the sequence of events and are proceeding with victim identification and body repatriation.

title: OpenAI’s Airbnb ties: Brian Chesky to friend Sam Altman; can’t use ChatGPT right now
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky expressed interest in integrating OpenAI's ChatGPT, but found its current SDK insufficient for their needs. While Airbnb already uses AI, the trend favors customizable open-source models, with Chinese tech giants like Alibaba leading the charge by releasing advanced, cost-effective systems and fostering a vast open-source AI ecosystem.

title: ‘Why single out India?’: Goyal slams double standards on Russian oil; flags exemptions
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal slammed Western nations' double standards on Russian oil, questioning Germany and UK's pursuit of sanctions exemptions. He asserted India's independent trade policy, stating the nation won't sign deals under pressure.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo probable to play vs Raptors despite toe sprain
content: Milwaukee Bucks' superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable for tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors, managing a left great toe sprain. Despite this, the team is optimistic about his availability, though his minutes may be managed. Guard Kevin Porter Jr. remains out with an ankle injury, impacting the Bucks' rotation. The Raptors expect a competitive lineup led by Scottie Barnes.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf’s daughter Jaz introduces adorable new partner Copper
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf's daughter, Jaz, has introduced a new cocker spaniel puppy named Copper to the family, delighting fans. The legendary tennis couple's children are described as normal, with Jaz enjoying typical teenage outings and son Jaden pursuing baseball. Agassi emphasizes fatherhood as his most important role, cherishing his bond with his children.

title: Kevin Garnett caught in NBA gambling scandal as his name surfaces in probe
content: The FBI's investigation into illicit gambling and poker activities has intensified, leading to the arrest of NBA players Terry Rozier and former player Chauncey Billups. Hall of Famer Kevin Garnett is also reportedly linked to private poker games investigated by the FBI, though he has not been charged with any wrongdoing.

title: Stephen and Ayesha Curry’s old “spicy” interview goes viral again
content: Stephen Curry's wife, Ayesha Curry, faces online criticism following recent podcast remarks about her marriage and past desires.  Despite the backlash, Stephen Curry has remained silent.  The couple previously shared insights into maintaining a vibrant relationship, emphasizing dating and mutual admiration.  Their enduring affection was evident in past interviews and public appearances, showcasing a decade of marriage.

title: Shocker! Shan Masood takes new role in PCB; first active Test captain to do so
content: Pakistan Cricket Board has appointed Test captain Shan Masood as Consultant of International Cricket, a move that places him within the board's administrative hierarchy while he continues to lead the national team. This unconventional dual role, announced by PCB on Friday, has sparked debate over governance and decision-making within Pakistan cricket.

title: Emman Atienza: How did the TikTok star, daughter of Kuya Kim Atienza die at 19
content: TikTok creator Emman Atienza, 19, daughter of TV host Kim Atienza, passed away by suicide in Los Angeles on October 22. Known for her honest discussions on self-love and mental health, her passing has deeply affected her family, friends, and thousands of young followers who found solace in her online presence.

title: Court seeks report on complaint seeking FIR against Vaishno Devi board for landslide deaths
content: A court in Katra has ordered police to submit an action taken report regarding a complaint alleging criminal negligence by Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board officials. The complaint seeks an FIR for the deaths of 34 pilgrims in a landslide on August 26, following weather warnings. The judge directed the report within two weeks.

title: BJP stops NC clean sweep in J&K RS poll, wins 1 seat with 4 'extra' votes
content: In Jammu and Kashmir's first Rajya Sabha election post-Article 370 abrogation, the BJP secured an unexpected victory for one of the four seats, garnering 32 votes. This win, despite the party's assembly strength, has led to allegations of cross-voting and a "fixed match" from opposition leaders.

title: Longevity hack: 5 foods that everyone over 40 must consume everyday
content: The combination of healthy fats, protein, fiber, vitamins and antioxidants makes nuts, including almonds, walnuts and pistachios an excellent choice for nutrition. Research indicates that nut consumption leads to decreased chances of developing cardiovascular diseases and metabolic conditions which impact aging processes

title: Judicial inquiry into Leh violence begins today; UT admin directs wide publicity
content: A judicial probe into the September 24 violence in Leh, which resulted in four fatalities, will commence on October 25. The inquiry, led by retired Supreme Court Justice Dr. B.S. Chauhan, will investigate the clash between protesters and security forces. Authorities are ensuring security, medical support, and public awareness for the proceedings.

title: Cardi B admits she wishes 'Offset was better' amid pregnancy with Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B is preparing to welcome her fourth child with Stefon Diggs while navigating a difficult divorce from Offset. She recently expressed her wish for Offset to be a better person for their children, acknowledging his past infidelity. Offset has since admitted to cheating, taking responsibility for his "bad decisions."

title: Kathua SSP suspends 8 cops after attack on Kerala preachers
content: Eight police personnel in Kathua have been suspended for negligence after a video surfaced showing them failing to prevent an attack on Kerala-based religious preachers. Assailants, accusing the preachers of illegal conversion, assaulted their vehicle.

title: 'Pak can't win war against India': Ex-CIA officer; claims US paid millions to ISI
content: Former CIA officer John Kiriakou stated Pakistan cannot win a conventional war against India and that provoking New Delhi hurts its own interests. He claimed the US "bought" cooperation from Pakistan's Pervez Musharraf with millions in aid, while the ISI continued terror activities against India. Kiriakou also alleged the Pentagon once controlled Pakistan's nukes.

title: India's greatest ODI cricketers: Shastri keeps Kohli on top; Bumrah misses out
content: Former India coach Ravi Shastri unveiled his top five ODI cricketers: Virat Kohli, Sachin Tendulkar, MS Dhoni, Kapil Dev, and Rohit Sharma. Shastri lauded their exceptional consistency, match-winning prowess, and significant contributions across generations, including multiple World Cup wins and captaincies. He emphasised their enduring legacies in Indian cricket history.

title: Milwaukee Bucks vs Raptors injury update: Giannis probable, Porter Jr out
content: The Toronto Raptors are set to host the Milwaukee Bucks on October 24, 2025, with both teams navigating injury concerns. While the Raptors have only minor absences, the Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo is probable despite a toe sprain, but Kevin Porter Jr. is out. This matchup promises an intense early-season battle.

title: ‘Lip service’: Jaishankar slams UN’s inaction on terror; cites Pahalgam terror attack
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar criticized the UN for its failure to act decisively against terrorism, citing the Pahalgam attack as an example of its undermined credibility due to political bias and structural paralysis. He highlighted how the organization's decision-making fails to reflect its membership or global priorities, with meaningful reforms being obstructed.

title: Sydney ODI sold out! Fans brace for Virat and Rohit's last dance Down Under
content: Sydney Cricket Ground is sold out for the final ODI between India and Australia, with fans anticipating Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's potential last appearances on Australian soil. Despite recent struggles, Kohli remains a major draw, while Sharma showed form in Adelaide. Team India aims to avoid a whitewash, while Australia seek a clean sweep.

title: Virat Kohli mobbed by fans in Sydney despite two ducks in ODI series – Watch
content: Despite a challenging ODI return in Australia, Virat Kohli's immense fan following remains evident, with supporters greeting him enthusiastically at Sydney Airport. While Kohli experienced rare consecutive ducks, former captain Michael Clarke backs him to lead the scoring in the final ODI, predicting a morale-boosting Indian victory ahead of the T20 series.

title: 'Called accused before suicide': New details in Satara doc's case; is there political link?
content: A woman doctor in Maharashtra's Satara district died by suicide, accusing PSI Gopal Badane and another man, Bankar, of rape and harassment. The accused PSI has been suspended and arrested, with authorities launching a thorough investigation into the grave allegations. The chief minister has ordered strict action against all involved.

title: 'He's got two ducks' - Ex-Aus captain predicts Kohli's performance in Sydney
content: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke backed Virat Kohli to be the leading run-scorer and Josh Hazlewood to take the most wickets in the final ODI against India. Clarke also predicted an Indian victory, hoping for a morale-boosting win for the hosts ahead of the T20I series.

title: Happy Chhath Puja 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages & quotes
content: Chhath Puja, a vibrant festival honoring Surya Dev and his consort Usha, is celebrated six days after Diwali. This unique nature-worship festival, observed over four days, involves rituals like holy dips and offerings to the setting and rising sun. Devotees express gratitude for life's sustenance and seek blessings for health and prosperity.

title: Longevity doctor explains why taking too much vitamin D supplements might be dangerous
content: While vitamin D is vital for bone and immune health, a longevity doctor warns against blindly supplementing. Excessive intake without testing can lead to harmful calcium buildup in arteries and kidneys. He stresses the importance of blood tests to determine individual needs and advises consulting a physician for proper dosage, highlighting magnesium and K2's role too.

title: Asia Cup trophy row gets uglier! Mohsin Naqvi drops to new low; provokesIndia
content: Nearly a month after their victory, India has yet to receive the Asia Cup 2025 trophy, reportedly held by Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi. Despite BCCI requests, Naqvi insists on a formal handover ceremony. The controversy overshadows India's win, with Pakistani media hailing Naqvi's actions as 'heroic' and lauding him for standing firm against the Team India players that wanted to celebrate their win.

title: 'Check for poisoning': Mystery deepens in ex-Punjab DGP's son's death; diary missing
content: Investigators are searching for a diary containing a dying declaration in the mysterious death of Aqil Akhtar, son of former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa. The FIR names Mustafa, his wife, daughter, and daughter-in-law. The post-mortem was inconclusive, with viscera analysis awaited. The family is expected back for questioning soon.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bournemouth ask clubs for £75m to sign Semenyo
content: Clubs like Chelsea and Liverpool will have to pay over £75 million in order to sign Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Trouble in ‘soy State’: Madhya Pradesh soybean farmers lose interest over multiple factors
content: Madhya Pradesh is India’s largest soybean producer, but young farmers are losing interest in farming, facing key issues such as improper implementation of minimum support price, seed quality, input cost and the possibility of the import of soybean and soybean meal from the United States. A.M. Jigeesh reports on a brewing crisis

title: Anganwadi workers’ union demands gratuity for retired employees
content: The government’s decision to provide gratuity to those who retire after 2023 should be modified and the gratuity should be applicable to all those who joined the service from 1975 and retired from 2011-12

title: BJP accuses Bengal Govt. of creating ‘fake citizens’ in border districts
content: The party claimed that these certificates are being used to create “fake voters” ahead of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls

title: Not-for-profit forum to be launched to address cyber challenges
content: The inaugural conclave of the forum was organised by alumni of Cyber Law & Cyber Forensics Programme, NLSIU

title: In a reform push, U.P. CM Yogi approves fivefold increase in the financial powers of PWD officers
content: In the revised structure, the Chief Engineer can now approve works up to ₹10 crores, up from ₹2 crores

title: Pregnant woman among other migrants languish in Bangladesh even after Calcutta High Court order; Trinamool points fingers at Centre
content: It has been four weeks since the Calcutta High Court directed authorities to bring back the six migrant workers who were pushed into Bangladesh months back

title: Lokesh pitches Andhra–Victoria cricket ties, eyes IPL-level talent pipeline
content: During a visit to Melbourne, HRD Minister explores joint training camps, eco-friendly stadiums, and digital fan engagement, as Andhra’s cricketing ambitions gain global traction through the APL and IPL 2025 prospects

title: Japan’s new PM commits to higher defence spend, ties with India, Quad
content: Sanae Takaichi said she ‘looks forward’ to promoting the Japan-India Strategic and Global Partnership; ‘in order to promote the main pillar of Tokyo’s diplomacy, a Free and Open Indo-Pacific, India is a crucial partner,’ says an Assistant Minister

title: India is a crucial partner on Indo-Pacific; PM Takaichi committed to building ties: Japanese government spokesperson
content: PM Takaichi expected to continue foreign policy of predecessors; immigration hard-line sparks concerns

title: Tax saving drives private bus operators to use out-of-State vehicles
content: Telangana has less than 100 private long-distance buses, buses registered in other parts of the country are used to plying long-distance routes so as to save on the tax component; once an All-India Permit is available, operators can ply buses on all available routes, a senior transport officer said

title: Judicial panel to begin inquiry into Leh violence from October 25
content: Justice B.S. Chauhan-led commission to record statements over deaths of four civilians during September protests

title: ECI mandates disclosure tag on AI-generated campaign videos
content: The ECI says it has been brought to its notice that the misuse of hyper-realistic synthetically generated information, including depicting political leaders as making electorally sensitive messages, is contaminating the level-playing field in the electoral arena, disrupting fair and equal conditions for all political participants.

title: Bengaluru–Hyderabad travellers demand more train options after Kurnool bus fire tragedy
content: Currently, a total of 28 trains operate between the two capitals on different days and timings, including the Yesvantpur–Kacheguda Vande Bharat Express, according to railway officials.

title: Shahabad struggle: NDA prepares to regain lost ground in former bastion
content: While the alliance won 19 of 22 seats in the 2010 election, its tally dropped to just two seats in 2020 in the region where political dynamics is heavily influenced by the Kushwaha and Rajput communities; this time, the BJP is contesting nine seats, the JD(U) eight, the RLM two, and the LJP (RV) three

title: Trump Considering Plans To Target Drug Facilities Inside Venezuela: Report
content: United States President Donald Trump is considering plans to target cocaine facilities and drug trafficking routes in Venezuela. However, no official plan has been made, US officials said, as reported by CNN.

title: Trump-Kim Jong Un Meeting "Not On Schedule" During Asia Trip: US Official
content: Donald Trump is not scheduled to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un while in South Korea next week, a senior US official said Friday, despite speculation about a meeting while the US president tours Asia.

title: In Emotional Speech, Zohran Mamdani Defends Muslim Identity Against "Racist" Attacks
content: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for New York City mayor, pledged Friday to further embrace his Muslim identity in response to growing attacks by former Gov. Andrew Cuomo and his surrogates that he characterized as "racist and baseless."

title: Israeli Strike Kills Hezbollah Commander In Lebanon
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement that it struck and killed a senior Hezbollah commander in southern Lebanon.

title: US Sanctions Colombia President Over Drug Allegations
content: The United States on Friday announced sanctions on Colombia's President Gustavo Petro, who Washington has accused of failing to curb illicit drug trafficking, alongside his wife and son.

title: Will Choose Death Over Returning To RJD, Says Tej Pratap Yadav
content: Former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav on Friday asserted that he will "choose death over returning to the RJD", from which he was expelled by his father Lalu Prasad a few months ago.

title: Not Allowing Hijab In School 'Denial Of Secular Education': Kerala Government To Court
content: The Kerala government on Friday told the High Court here that not permitting a Muslim girl to wear her headscarf (hijab) to school was an "invasion" of her privacy and dignity and a "denial of her right to secular education".

title: Say 'Please', 'Sorry', 'Thank you': Haryana Top Cop On Being Polite To Public
content: Haryana DGP O P Singh emphasised that polite behaviour with the public is crucial and asked police officials to use simple and courteous words like 'please', 'sorry' and 'thank you', saying this will improve the image of the police.

title: UP Minister Baby Rani Maurya's Car Gets Hit By Truck, She Escapes Unhurt
content: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Baby Rani Maurya had a close shave when a truck driver lost control over the vehicle and hit her car on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday night, an official said.

title: "His Statement Was Twisted": Siddaramaiah On Son's "Political Life" Remark
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday clarified that his son Yathindra Siddaramaiah did not name anyone as his successor.

title: Liquor Smugglers Attack Police Team In 'Dry' Bihar, Injure 5 Personnel
content: In a brazen display of audacity, liquor smugglers in 'dry' Bihar attacked a police team that had gone to a village for a raid and injured at least five personnel.

title: 21-Year-Old Arrested For Smuggling Liquor From Haryana In Ambulance
content: A 21-year-old man was arrested after a brief chase with a large consignment of illegal alcohol in Delhi's Dwarka, an official said on Friday.

title: Highlights: Bengaluru-Bound Bus With 40 Onboard Catches Fire After Hitting Bike, 20 Dead
content: Hyderabad-Bengaluru Bus Accident Highlights: At least 20 people died after a Bengaluru-bound private bus caught fire and turned into ashes after hitting a bike in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool in the early hours of Friday.

title: National Conference Wins 3 Seats, BJP 1 In J&K's 1st Rajya Sabha Polls
content: The results of Jammu and Kashmir's first Rajya Sabha polls after becoming a Union Territory followed expected lines, with the ruling National Conference securing three seats on Friday and the BJP clinching the final one

title: 7 Boys Go For A Swim In Andhra River, 4 Swept Away By Surging Currents
content: Tragedy struck Vedanthapuram village near Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh on Friday evening when four boys were swept away by the surging currents of the Swarnamukhi river while swimming.

title: Man Cornered In Mumbai Flight Over Not Speaking Marathi Shares Ordeal
content: In an incident of unruly behaviour that unfolded midair, a passenger forced another flyer to speak in Marathi if he wanted to stay in Mumbai. The incident, which was recorded on a mobile camera, happened on an Air India flight to Mumbai.

title: Drugs Worth Rs 109 Crore Seized In Delhi NCR, 26 Foreigners Arrested
content: The DRI has dismantled a narcotics manufacturing and distribution network operating across the Delhi-NCR region and seized contraband worth about Rs 109 crore and arrested 26 foreign nationals.

title: On Camera, Man Urinates Out Of Moving Thar In Gurugram
content: A video which is going viral shows a Mahindra Thar being driven recklessly near the Sadar Bazaar area in the city while the passenger stands on the side step with the door open and urinates from the moving vehicle.

title: Delhi Sees Coolest October Night In 2 Years; Air Quality Remains 'Poor'
content: The city recorded its lowest minimum temperature in October in the last two years, dropping to a minimum of 17 degrees Celsius on Thursday night, while the air quality improved, moving into the 'poor' category after remaining in the 'very poor' categ

title: 13-Year-Old Asked To Submit "Virginity Test" By School, Case Filed
content: Police lodged an FIR against a school-cum-madrassa here based on a man's complaint that her 13-year-old daughter was asked to submit a "virginity test" report for admission into the institute.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Assam SIT hopeful of Singapore’s help
content: The Special Investigating Team went to the island country to seek CCTV footage and statements from those who had accompanied the Assamese cultural icon on the yacht on the day he died

title: Kurnool tragedy: Mother and son from Bengaluru among the victims
content: The Karnataka government has sent a team of officials from the Transport Department to Kurnool in Andhra Pradesh. The officials have been instructed to identify victims from Karnataka and extend necessary assistance to their families

title: Chandrababu Naidu discusses bilateral trade, AI-based citizen services with UAE leaders
content: Food security, logistics, transportation, and infrastructure investment opportunities also come up for discussion; at a Telugu diaspora event, the Chief Minister highlights the role of the Telugus in supporting Andhra Pradesh’s growth and global collaborations

title: RBI to establish regional office in Amaravati
content: The new office will be developed in approximately 1.6 lakh square feet, with an overall investment exceeding ₹200 crore to strengthen the bank’s operational capabilities and services in the region

title: Engrossed in power fight, Congress leaders have forgotten their responsibilities, says Union Minister
content: Taking exception to what he termed as degrading language in political criticism, the Union Minister says the people of both Karnataka and Telangana were closely observing the developments and they would soon teach them a lesson

title: Samajwadi Party plans region-centric manifestos to counter BJP's narrative in Uttar Pradesh
content: Party strategists entrusted with the responsibility argue that each region has different geographical, economic challenges and opportunities, and addressing it will be the focus of the SP’s localised manifestos. The party will however release a State-level manifesto too.

title: ‘Vision 2031’ stresses on increased power generation, climate-resilient power infrastructure and new technologies
content: The draft document outlines the department’s plans for modernisation of existing hydropower projects, fostering e-mobility initiatives and the seamless integration of renewable energy and energy storage mechanisms into the Kerala power system

title: Civet coffee’s unique flavour linked to fat composition, finds Central University of Kerala study
content: Civet-processed beans are larger and contains higher fat contents than manually collected ones. Elevated level of caprylic acid and capric acid methyl esters, compounds responsible for coffee’s creamy aroma and enhanced flavour, found in civet-proceed beans, according to study

title: Paddy procurement touches record levels amidst bumper harvest in Delta districts
content: Across the districts, the procurement has increased by several times and official machinery has also transported record quantity of the produce to storage points and hulling centres

title: Bus accidents in Andhra Pradesh led to 115 deaths in 2023, a decrease from 221 deaths in 2022
content: Bus accidents in Andhra Pradesh resulted in 1.41% of the deaths due to road accidents in 2023, whereas two-wheelers resulted in over 50% of deaths due to road accidents

title: Congress, BJP spar over OBC politics in Bihar
content: Congress says Karpoori Thakur govt. fell in Bihar in late 1970s as Jan Sangh withdrew support over OBC quota, while   BJP reminds Congress of how it humiliated OBC leader Sitaram Kesri

title: Agriculture Department advises steps to rejuvenate crops damaged by heavy rains
content: Officials emphasise need for quick drainage of rainwater, timely fungicide application, and balanced fertilisation to mitigate losses and restore productivity

title: Rajnath meets Army commanders, reviews security situation
content: During the conference, detailed deliberations were held with the senior leadership of the Army on key aspects, including grey zone warfare, the roadmap for jointness, Aatmanirbharta and innovation.

title: World Bank approves over 2,450-cr. loan for health system improvement in Kerala
content: The programme will ensure a 40% increase in patients whose hypertension is controlled and 60% increase in cervical and breast cancer screening for women to accelerate efforts to end preventable deaths

title: Experts urge students to blend skills and knowledge at seminar in Bapatla
content: Speakers from SRM University–AP and The Hindu FIC highlight the importance of communication, continuous learning, and career clarity for engineering students

title: CPI registers profound disquiet over Kerala government keeping LDF and Cabinet in the dark about PM SHRI MoU
content: Party State secretary criticised General Education Minister V. Sivankutty for showing “undue haste” in signing the MoU without the cabinet’s or LDF’s approval. At the same time, he signalled that the CPI was willing to give the government a breather

title: Supreme Court to hear contempt plea over lawyer’s attack on CJI Bench
content: Chief Justice Gavai had himself brushed off the incident as inconsequential and a “forgotten chapter”

title: Union Minister Bhupathiraju Srinivasa Varma emphasises speedy completion of railway projects in Andhra Pradesh
content: He assures Central Government’s support for the development of the Vijayawada Division and swift completion of all pending projects

title: Microsoft India MD urges students to embrace technology and leadership qualities
content: Rajiv Kumar highlights the role of AI and emerging technologies in shaping the global economy and stresses the importance of continuous learning, decision-making, and effective communication for students to tackle future challenges

title: Calcutta High Court withdraws protection to BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari for registration of FIRs against him
content: The High Court also quashed 15 FIRs against the West Bengal LoP and directed officials to set up SITs in four other cases; earlier in December 2022, the Calcutta High Court had ruled that its permission was necessary before lodging an FIR against the Nandigram MLA

title: Andhra Pradesh prioritises forest conservation and eco-tourism initiatives
content: Forests are a national asset and their protection is a collective responsibility, says Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan; he also calls for effective steps to prevent human-wildlife conflicts

title: Gyan Bharatam Mission to sign MoUs with institutes for conservation of manuscripts
content: 20 institutues to ink deal with the Culture Ministry’s flagship initiative on Saturday, 30 more to follow later

title: PM SHRI signing a tactical decision: Minister
content: Sivankutty says government not ready to give up on funds for Samagra Shiksha and other projects.    The PM SHRI scheme will wind up by March 2027. By signing the MoU, the State will get the arrears due to Samagra Shiksha Kerala and two years of PM SHRI funds, which together come to ₹1,476.13 crore

title: 69 candidates receive appointment orders at Rozgar Mela in Vijayawada
content: Central government has provided employment to nearly 10 lakh youth through 17 editions of the Rozgar Mela, says Union Minister

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin inaugurates renovated Tholkappia Poonga
content: The park has been upgraded with additional amenities and features including a skywalk at a cost of ₹42.45 crore. It is now open to walkers and visitors on all days and will offer guided tours for the public and eco-tours for students

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 8
content: Mike Clay explains why he's a lineup lock against the Cowboys . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . we have folded the Shadow Reports into the game-by-game breakdowns here .

title: Battle for Bihar: Candidates, caste, key contests - 5 numbers that'll shape poll fight

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: How Giannis and the Bucks managed an awkward offseason
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appeared on a projector screen in the interview room . it was the first day a team could officially gather before the start of training camp . he had come down with COVID the week before and had not been cleared to travel .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: NBA Cup: Court designs for 2025 edition of the tournament
content: the Emirates NBA Cup 2025 is around the corner -- games tip off on Oct. 31 . each team will play four group-play games on designated "Cup Nights" eight teams will advance to the knockout rounds, with a chance to win the trophy .

title: 'Looks patriotic but ...': Reagan's prophetic warning about Trump trade war - watch

title: Can yeast survive on Mars? IISc, Isro scientists find promising clues
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More

title: UConn reveal championship rings designed by Bueckers, Fudd and Ducharme
content: the men's basketball team held a private event to receive their championship rings from their 2025 NCAA national championship run . they defeated south Carolina 82-59 in the title game, anchored by Sarah Strong's 24 points, 15 rebounds and five assists . the rings are filled with detail that represents the title won, as well as trace of team identity and tradition .

title: Gulf Air fined for barring ex-MLA over 'no surname'
content: Ram M Sundaram is an Assistant Editor at The Times of India, Chennai, where he covers commute, trial courts, and political affairs.

title: Trump ends trade talks with Canada ahead of Asia trip where confrontations loom
content: the move threatens to unravel testy economic ties between the u.s. and its northern neighbor . the move, triggered by a ad featuring audio from conservative icon Ronald Reagan criticizing protectionism, threatens a critical review of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement .

title: 100,000 Sikh truckers in America in hot seat after twin crashes draw scrutiny
content: more than 100,000 immigrant truckers from india are in the hot seat in America . a sweeping US federal audit conducted amid twin fatal crash investigations involving Sikh drivers showed widespread malpractice in issuance of commercial driving licenses . the audit found as many as 25 % or more of “non-domiciled” CDLs issued in California were improperly granted .

title: Coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the Dallas Wings , New York Liberty and Seattle Storm cut ties with their head coaches following the 2025 season . the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire joined the WNBA next year . a day later, the Storm filled their open position by hiring from the college ranks . now, there's just one head coaching position open, at new york .

title: 'Can wear hijab': HC's relief for Kerala student; welcomes 'better sense'
content: a bench of justice V G Arun closed the petition . the petition was filed by the manager of the school in palluruthy . it challenged a notice directing the school authorities to permit a girl student to attend classes wearing a headscarf .
